Sentencas: This work focuses on the structural, microstructural, electrical and electrochemical characterization of La-Ni-0 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering under different argon partial pressures.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: Deposition was driven by Plasma Emission Monitoring system (PEM) which allows high deposition rate.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: For each pressure, the optimal regulation setpoint for lanthanum oxide deposition is determined and then the current dissipated on the nickel target is adjusted to obtain the convenient La/Ni ratio to achieve the K2NiF4 structure.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: After an appropriate annealing treatment, coatings crystallize in the desired structure with more or less impurities.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: Increasing the device's pressure from 0.4 to 4.8 Pa produces more porous samples with different microstructures.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: Then, a coating with porosity gradient was built by using these four different total pressures.
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: Its electrical performances were tested and allowed its utilization as cathode layer in intermediate temperature-solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC).
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring

Sentencas: This modified architecture cathode allows better performances (71 mW.cm(-2)) than dense cathode produced by the same technique (51 mIN.cm(-2)).
Titulo: Effect of total pressure on La2NiO4 coatings deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering using plasma emission monitoring
